What personal data does DAAD collect when I visit their website?
DAAD collects data like your IP address, date/time of access, operating system, domain name, and duration of visit to ensure technical operation and service provision (GDPR Article 6(1)f).

What happens to my data if I fill out DAAD’s contact form?
Mandatory details (e.g., name, email, education level) are processed to address your request and erased once resolved. Voluntary info (e.g., age) is deleted if no longer needed.

Does DAAD share my data with third parties?
Yes, but only with processors (e.g., tech providers), public authorities (if legally required), or partners (with consent). Non-EU recipients follow GDPR safeguards like standard contractual clauses.

How long does DAAD keep my personal data?
Data is retained only as long as necessary for its purpose (e.g., contact requests are deleted after resolution). Consent-based data is kept until revoked.

What are my rights under GDPR as a DAAD website user?
You can access, correct, or request deletion of your data; restrict processing; object to legitimate interest-based use; or lodge complaints with a supervisory authority.

What’s DAAD’s policy on social media plugins (e.g., Facebook)?
Social plugins (Facebook, Twitter, etc.) only transmit data if you click their buttons. DAAD has no control over data collected by these platforms—check their privacy policies for details.

How does DAAD handle YouTube videos on its website?
Videos are deactivated by default—clicking the preview connects to Google’s servers. DAAD has no control over data Google collects; review YouTube’s privacy policy for details.
